snippet.title: How IBM's Node-RED is hacking together the internet of things
snippet.description: IBM's Node-RED visual coding tools are simplifying the job of wiring up today's world of computers, sensors and online services.

snippet.title: How Israel is rewriting the future of cybersecurity and creating the next Silicon Valley

snippet.title: Understanding what motivates Chinese hackers
snippet.description: Michael P. Kassner, with the help of a noted academic and author, looks at what motivates Chinese hackers. It may not be what you think.

snippet.title: Interview with Geek & Sundry cofounder and The Guild producer Kim Evey
snippet.description: Felicia Day's producing partner Kim Evey talks about working on Geek & Sundry, shooting a convention for The Guild, geeking out over Doctor Who and John Scalzi, and more.

snippet.title: Guarding your personal security while living in the cloud
snippet.description: Nick Hardiman takes a look at the threat landscape of our increasing dependence on the cloud as repository for our data and personal information.

snippet.title: The iPad's most useful apps, updated for 2012
snippet.description: While the iPad has its limitations, it's really good at a few basic functions. These 22 apps play to the iPad's strengths.
